comp

Class RobotOperationTracker

  • java.lang.Object
    • comp.RobotOperationTracker

  • public class RobotOperationTracker
extends java.lang.Object
    This class tracks a series of operations to be performed by a Robot, and can instruct the robot to perform those operations. Meant for easy manipulation of robot; accepts a Robot.Direction value to its add method and from this automatically tracks what operations must be performed by the robot to move in that direction. Some of this code may prove useful to refactor into a RobotDriver.
    Author:
    Elijah Mas

      • getCurrentMove

        private RobotMove getCurrentMove()
        If the most recent operation of operations is a RobotMove instance, return it; otherwise, create a new RobotMove instance and add it to operations, then return it
        Returns:
        a RobotMove instance which is the current move being handled by the tracker

      • add

        public void add(Robot.Direction d)

        Establish a new operation in the tracker. The operation can be either a move (RobotMove) or rotation (RobotRotation).

        Provide a direction d where the tracker should go next. If d is forward, then the tracker moves in the current direction, which is encoded by incrementing the distance of the current move operation in operations. If d is not forward, then the tracker must rotate to d before moving, which is encoded by adding a new rotation operation to operations and then adding a new move operation with distance set to 1.

        Parameters:
        d -

      • addRotation

        private void addRotation(Robot.Turn turn)
        Add a new rotation for a certain Robot.Turn to operations
        Parameters:
        turn - a value of Robot.Turn

      • getDirectionOfNextMove

        private Robot.Direction getDirectionOfNextMove()
        Calculate which cell the tracker should move to next, and get the Robot.Direction value that corresponds to moving to this cell from the current cell.
        Returns:
        Robot.Direction value to move to the next cell

      • exitAvailable

        private static boolean exitAvailable(int[] xy,
                                     Distance distance)

      • buildExitPath

        public void buildExitPath()
        Construct a series of RobotOperation operations which, when applied to a robot, will move it from the starting cell of a maze to and out of the exit.

      • testManhattanDistanceIsOne

        private boolean testManhattanDistanceIsOne(int x,
                                           int y,
                                           int[] currentPosition)
        Test that the Manhattan distance between two coordinates is 1. Used in buildExitPath().
        Parameters:
        x - x-value of first coordinate
        y - y-value of first coordinate
        currentPosition - second coordinate
        Returns:
        true if Manhattan distance is 1, false otherwise (prints error message)
